page.title: 11TWO SCHOOLS IN OUR AREA
page.content: Bishop Ullathorne Comprehensive, Coventry,is named after the first Catholic Bishop of Birmingham. Father Ullathorne ministered in Coventry in the 1840's.(St.Osburg's Church was builtin 1846). The school now has 1000 pupils drawn from south Coventry. The buildings are modern(1950's)set in 54 acres close to Kenilworth. There is an Adult Education Centre on the same site and also the Coventry Schools of Music, Fashion and Theatre are situated there. Wainbody Wood School,named after the adjoining woods, is also a Coventry LEA school, on the southern edge of the city, near Gibbet Hill crossroads.It is a purpose-built modern school opened in 1965 to cater for the needs of children with emotional and behavioural problems.It has about 40 pupils.
